comments.commentBody: Here in California, with some of the absolute worst schools in the nation, a majority of school districts pay their teachers $75k a year in outright compensation for working 1 day over half of the calendar year.  No wonder teachers grumble when the public complains.  They have one of the sweetest deals around, not to mention that they can retire like royalty a full 10 years before private sector workers and with CALPERS.  Share the pain, public sector employees or lose your jobs.  It's your choice.

Almost everything you wrote about science and nature is right. The problem is that society's choices are not made through a purely scientific calculation -- whether you or I or anyone else likes the outcome.

68 Andy Revkin: The Cultural Cognition project is nonsense. Culturally grounded differences in belief are nonsense. The Nobel Divide and the Climate Divide is also nonsense. Belief is nonsense. Believe nothing.

Nature isn't just the final authority on truth, Nature is the Only authority. There are zero human authorities. Scientists do not vote on what is the truth. There is only one vote and Nature owns it. We find out what Nature's vote is by doing Scientific [public and replicable] experiments. Scientific [public and replicable] experiments are the only source of truth. [To be public, it has to be visible to other people in the room. What goes on inside one person's head isn't public unless it can be seen on an X-ray or with another instrument.]
Science is a simple faith in Scientific experiments and a simple absolute lack of faith in everything else.

Almost everything you wrote about science and nature is right. The problem is that society's choices are not made through a purely scientific calculation -- whether you or I or anyone else likes the outcome.

After enumerating the changes in compensation to the Wisconsin public workers that are in the bill, Mr. Schneider states "In the fall, Walker campaigned on these issues, ..."

Well, yes, and many would agree, including many of those marching in Madison. What he did *not* campaign on, was that he would use, as an unnecessary means to that end, changes in the entire relationship between public unions and the state, in ways that greatly diminish these unions' capacity to serve in much of a role at all. As it turns out, the majority of people in Wisconsin recognize this as a bait and switch, and aren't buying it.

It began with the now renervated President Reagan when he fired the air traffic controllers. (I, at the time, agrees with him -- some civil service employees (e.g., police, fire fighters... are so vital to the safe and viable functioning of our country) that a strike could lead to catastrophe.

But, this gave a signal that the GOP was going to break unions. Union membershi has gone from about 35% of American workers in the 1960's; it is now about 7%; and back in the 1960's the ratio of average worker in a corporation compared to the CEO, it was about 1 to 40; now, it is 1 to about 300 to 400. This will destroy the middle class... And a viable democracy.

The recent ruling of the Supreme Court (corporations can give as much money to political campaigns as they wish -- doesn't help). So, as unions (as a group) are the only organizations who
consistently support the Democratic Party -- the corporate interests sans unions will control the elections.

This is what Wisconsin is all about. Break the unions and merge the government with the super-rich and the corporations. That's called facsism!

As Sarah Palin would say, 'Howdya like that?'

In a twisted, never been seen political movement in our country...the President of the United States is promoting and encouraging, insurrection and civil unrest.

It is a radical and unpredictable move that has the potential of growing to a point of uncontrolled mob response. If this is, as evidence shows, the Obama Machine of new politics...inciting the young and vulnerable...one must ask...to what end?

Is this not, President Obama waging political war on the leaders of States that are trying to solve their failing economies and failing State budgets? The country has been put through hell with the Obama initiatives...he is now positioned to do the same with the economies of individual States around our country...targeting newly elected Governors of States he needs for his re-election.

Is this the second phase of the Obama movement? The first was his use of power to dominate Washington (which he succeeded in) is it now to weaken and control those Governors of States that do not conform to his ideology?

Look for a turbulent next 18 months of the Obama Machine in full action, poisoning the atmosphere of civil debate, using his Union connections of intimidation, coercion and widely inflated untruths of the American problems...targeting good people who are intent to correct the problems we face.

President Obama...not a leader that this country needs right now.

Steve,
I already told you of their military mafia running at least 40% of the economy.
Suleiman is now out of the way,. Now the pro-democracy movement must apply pressure.
Obama is not going to help, as his slack-jawed response to the Bahrain massacres has proven.
Go back and check out their spineless response to the Honduran coup.
Could the GObstructionistP waste any more time? L' Orange Boehner's "Not Ready For Primetime" has reached new heights in six short weeks. How pathetic.

Cjm Esq, the additional cuts voted down by most members would have affected Congress. It's far too important to be cut by Boehner's ilk, don't you know?

Children, the poor, those who are dying for lack of health care, clean air an honest markets -- now those are cuts they can make!

Shut down the government, They threaten. Good Idea. Let's do. Just to see how much we miss it. I suspect not much. I know I won't. Then let us slowly  rethink the whole thing. Government on all levels in this country, is covered with leaches that bleed us dry. The entire government needs to be re-thought from top to bottom. LET US DO IT NOW.

Talk about sacrifice... We, American soldiers and taxpayers, have been funding 2 wars with blood and money, respectively, for how many years and for what insane,trumped up purpose? Then on top of this, our supposed Representatives were asleep at the wheel while Wall Street ran amoke and brought our economy to it's knees with no sacrifice put forth by the people who gained the most from this calmity. Pure insanity.
When have you heard a Congressmen/women say they would be willing to SACRIFICE 20 % of salary towards reducing our debt? Don't old your
breath.

We've got a little problem in California with our budget. Here's how it works: Public employee unions make contributions to legislators. Actually, these are not contributions so much as investments, because the legislators then sign sweetheart contracts with the unions. Now we're $25 billion in the hole and it gets worse every year.

Wisconsin is showing us how to solve this problem.

Well, it's really heartening to see so many intelligent posts here.  It looks like some people are awakening to what the GOP stands for and what sort of immature, self-serving and UNPATRIOTIC nitwits they are.  Hopefully, at some point the electorate will see this and realize what they've done in the last election.  We are going to see a barrage of GOP-inspired idiocy that neither the Senate nor the President will approve for the next 2 years at least.  God help us.

I'm always surprised by people who supported the bail outs, but want heavy taxation on corporations. While I have my own questions about some of the budget decisions made, I am not sure how people can demand more jobs and at the same time want to create an environment that will send corporations (where the jobs come from) packing.
Personally, I don't understand why more wasn't done in terms of welfare reform. While I know there are people who are truly unable to support themselves and are in need of assistance, there are a HUGE number of people who are simply milking the system. It goes on for generations.
Let's face it, we had 8 years under Jennifer Granholm in which she spent, spent, spent and pushed the problem down the road rather than dealing with it. Governor Snyder walked into a disaster and there's no way we're going to get through this without some harsh decisions being made. I for one am glad we have someone who is willing to step up to the plate and make some real effort and not just let this problem get bigger so he can dump it on his predecessor so everyone will hate him/her.

There is something in the air when Republicans feel the need to resort to using their Thesaurus' in order to bad mouth the president.
Get over yourselves people. He is the President, will continue as President and will again be the President!
The harder you try the more difficult you will find the situation for yourselves. You have backed yourselves into a corner
The Elephant in the room is showing its true colors and they are not red white and blue--they are shades of green. Green as in greed.
All of the newbies have demonstrated their lack of savvy in their willingness to leapfrog over the lives of millions of American citizens by attempting to throw us to the lions with regard to health care and Social Security etc., etc. You will pay dearly - I for one welcome the SHUTDOWN.Just long enough so that you feel the pressure and long enough to ensure that 2012 will not be yours.!!

You have attempted to make our government and its people about party politics and not the welfare of our country and now will have to pay the price. The charade has gone on far too long.

With regard to Boehner's/republicans recent rhetoric about budget deficit reduction,  if he/they were truly serious about the budget deficit he/they would be discussing ways to reduce the  defense budget of $700 billion/per year, which is wasteful and unconscionable in our current  condition, or reestablishing tax levels  toward the preBush cuts (e.g., in 20% increments) . But they prefer to target the standard of living of and programs for hardworking and disadvantaged Americans as well as programs that have distinguished our country (e.g., research/education). They say that they have heard the voice of the American people. Listen to Wisconsin and learn that the American voice is fluid and heterogeneous.
Lets close the Post Office forever. What a total waste that is. Serious mail travels in other ways. Hauling junk mail around is beyond foolish.

I'm concerned when party lines are drawn in the sand and we the people suffer. Republicans add hidden agendas to their budget proposal for 2012 cutting the federal funding for a law suit against Arizona to halt their immigration laws. Is that really a 1.5 trillion dollar budget issue? Cut programs that protect the air we breath, the water we drink and the exposure to toxins and chemicals that cause us, our children and our loved ones from becoming gravely ill in the name of balancing the budget and special large business interest. The democrats spend us and our children's children in to a financial hole in which generations may never recover in the name of bail outs that only help the disconnected few from the real on the street man. Auto makers, wall street, fanny may, banks bail outs helped my children how exactly? What may be done cannot be undone. This approach has only made the problem bigger. Bigger budgets and helping the special few not me and mine.

I was raise to believe that values such as taking care of your elders and your children was important. I believed that education was the only way a country seen as a world leader would continue in a future of instability.

Why is it that both parties are so concerned with out doing one another and have forgotten about our children, my aging parents, my grandchildren and their children. What about me. In the words of my grandmother and grandfather that went through the first "great recession", sham on you! Both parties are cutting social security, medicare, education pell grants to poor college students, single mothers and little children programs to help the down trodden. Revamp is needed, yes. Do away with fraud and the system of supporting the fraudulent. Do away with the over spending and special allocations of funds from worthy causes and get back to the great nation we once where, one based on principals and become the nation we used to be, a nation that took care or it's own!

To our Canadian friends here:

I like you guys. I think you're great neighbors.and I appreciate that. But the fact is, if I posted in the Globe and Mail and tried to explain Canadian politics to you, you'd think I was an egregious buttinski, right? And if I added insulting remarks about the stupidity of Canadian voters, you'd probably consider me an ill-bred boor to boot.
Mary (#52) . . . EXCELLENT comment . . . one of the very best I have read!!!!  :-)

Posts 8 and 9--You guys are fools.  The Democrats are burying themselves with this tactic.  The 2012 election will be decided right there, in Wisconsin, Michigan and Ohio, right after the Democrats finish stinking the place out.

So let me be sure i understand this. First the President presents a budget that deals with the deficit by ignoring it. Now it turns out that when the budget debate comes to a head next month he'll be in El Salvador. Is this right?

I thought nobody could possibly be as egeregious as Jimmy Carter, but maybe Barack can give him a run for his money after all.

Milton Friedman said about welfare: stop all payments and in three months we'll see who really needs it. Lets apply that to a Federal shutdown. Shut down everything but defense and security spending and lets see if we need it, at least from the Federal level.
Cut spending first, don't pass an extension. Don't raise or lower taxes. Just cut spending - preferably to 2008 levels.

NFL players make the least money of any athletes in this country's major sports. They have the shortest careers and they risk the worst injuries. Furthermore, their contracts are not guaranteed. Then, they get nearly nothing in retirement and end up all over television as "analysts." On top of all that, the NFL exploits a totally free minor league system ("college" football) that sends it the cream of the crop and throws the rest away, never to be heard from again. Why any young athlete chooses football over any of the other sports is totally beyond comprehension. I don't think this is all Gene Upshaw's fault, but NFL owners sure do have a nice racket going.

They couldn't pay their mortgage and were foreclosed on by the bank. Funny how the average homeowner doesn't yell classic swindle and sue. The rich have a sense of privilege the peasants wouldn't dream of. It couldn't happen to a nicer guy.
